Joint probabilities are often presented in a table such as the one shown in the
following table. According to the following table, P(R) = 0.12 and R3 = 0.10) = 0.50.
This is the probability represented in the cell at the intersection of the column labeled
Rg = 0.10 and the row labeled RA = 0.12. Similarly, P(R) = 0.20 and Rg = 0.10) = 0.
